title: Sidmouth to Branscombe Walk Route

images.title: Derek Harper / Sidmouth from Salcombe Hill Cliff
images.caption: Sidmouth from Salcombe Hill Cliff. A view of the resort from the coast path to the east, with Peak Hill and High Peak rising beyond.

images.title: RichTea / CC BY-SA (https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0)
images.caption: Path down from Salcombe Hill Cliff, Sidmouth. A view of the path from the hairpin bend halfway down. At the bottom, the path meets the bridge over the River Sid. It forms part of the South-West Coast Path.

images.title: David Hawgood / Chapman's Rocks and red-stained sea
images.caption: Chapman's Rocks and red-stained sea. The red mudstone cliffs near Salcombe Mouth are breaking down to fine particles that stay suspended in the water.

images.title: Derek Harper / Clifftop, Dunscombe Cliff
images.caption: Clifftop, Dunscombe Cliff. The coast path has been reopened after landslips, but naturally finds itself a little further north than hitherto. In the distance is the coast between Budleigh Salterton and Exmouth.

images.title: Derek Harper / Dunscombe Cliff
images.caption: Dunscombe Cliff. Peering down to the beach at Hook Ebb from the coast path. A nearby spot height is 156 metres. But the drop is by no means vertical, as the wooded slopes below show.

images.title: David Stowell / Dunscombe Cliff
images.caption: Dunscombe Cliff. Looking Eastwards along the coast from Salcombe Hill Cliff towards Dunscombe cliff. In the foreground are the steps of the South West Coastal path and at the beach is Salcombe Mouth

images.title: Tony Atkin / Looking over Weston Combe
images.caption: Looking over Weston Combe In the foreground is the chalk rock that makes up the top of these cliffs. This shot shows the southern edge of this square.

images.title: Humphrey Bolton / Branscombe
images.caption: Branscombe. This is the view of Branscombe village that appears when walking from the coast.

description: This walk follows a section of the South West Coast Path from Sidmouth to Branscombe. The route is just under 5 miles along an undulating path with excellent views for most of the way. The walk starts in Sidmouth and heads east along the waymarked path up to Salcombe Hill Cliff. Turn around here and there are fine views back to the town. The path continues east to the Higher and Lower Dunscombe Cliffs, passing Chapman's Rocks on the way. The cliffs are one of the high points of the walk, commanding excellent views in both directions. The path continues to Weston Cliff and Coxe's Cliff before descending into Branscombe where the route finishes.
